abstract.t: This document describes a further extension to the Sieve Vacation extension, allowing multiple auto-replies to the same sender in a single day by adding a ":time" parameter.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The Sieve Vacation extension defines a mechanism to generate automatic replies to incoming email messages. Through the ":days" parameter, it limits the number of auto-replies to the same sender to one per [n] days, for a specified number of days. But there are cases when one needs more granularity, if one would like to generate "vacation" replies for shorter-term situations ("in a meeting", for example, or "out to lunch").
This extension defines a ":time" parameter to provide more granularity for such situations.

section.title: Terminology Used in This Document
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119 .

section.title: Time Parameter
section.t: The purpose of the ":time" parameter is to specify the minimum time interval (in seconds) between consecutive auto-replies to a given sender. The ":time" value, if specified, is used instead of the ":days" value, and works in a similar way (see the Vacation extension for details). Only one of ":days" and ":time" is allowed -- both MAY NOT be specified (it is a compile-time error to do so).
The capability string associated with this extension is "vacation-time".

The time value is specified in seconds, and MUST be greater than or equal to 0 and less than 2**31. All valid values MUST be accepted without error, but sites MAY define a minimum value to actually be used if a smaller value is specified. If 0 is specified and used, it means that all auto-replies are sent, and no attempt is made to suppress consecutive replies.
If ":time" and ":days" are both omitted, a site-defined interval is used (see ).

figure.artwork: Usage: vacation [":days" number | ":time" number] [":subject" string] [":from" string] [":addresses" string-list] [":mime"] [":handle" string] <reason: string>

section.title: Example
section.t:
This example will automatically reply to senders with a message that the recipient is in a meeting. Multiple replies to the same sender will only be sent every half hour (1800 seconds).
require ["vacation", "vacation-time"]; vacation :addresses ["tjs@example.edu", "ts4z@landru.example.edu"] :time 1800 "I am in a meeting, and do not have access to email.";

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: Security considerations for the Sieve Vacation extension apply equally here. In addition, implementations SHOULD consider the number of auto-replies that might be generated by allowing small values of ":time" (including 0).

list.t: adds the ":time" parameter to the Sieve Vacation extension. Implementations that support this MUST also support "vacation".
